title: Not style pictured, handles made for baby hands.
review: I also received the cup with the tiny handles and a narrow base.  NOT WHAT IS PICTURED, NOT WHAT I ORDERED! Very disappointed.

title: Not made for adults
review: This cup is being sold as an Adult cup, it is a babies cup. It is so small, the handles are way to small for an adult. Do not bother getting this unless you need it for a very small child.

title: Hot Liquids Take on a Strong Plastic Taste
review: This cup is fine for cold liquids, but if you put anything hot into it, like tea, coffee, or milk, it takes on a distinct taste of plastic.  I had washed it thoroughly by hand before using, and tried running it through the dishwasher to get rid of the plastic taste but nothing worked.  The item's description says it is good for either hot or cold liquids, but I advise against buying it with the intention of using for anything but cold.

title: WASTE OF MONEY
review: After reading the reviews, only a handful received the wrong cup so I took a gamble and lost. IF YOU CHANGE THE PRODUCT, CHANGE THE PICTURE.  This is actually fraud. I could buy this cup in the dollar store.  It's absolutely useless. I don't think a child could get all fingers in the handles.

title: Useless
review: This was definitely designed as a kids sippy cup. My brother who has hand tremors took one look and said no. His arthritic finger couldn't hold the cup and CV he ani were a bit disappointed in the size i know it says it hols 8 oz. We soon realized every drink came in 10, 12 16 oz.  I couldn't even get my neighbor who has a 14 month old to take them. Into the donate bag.

title: Tiny
review: The handles are surprisingly small. I can only fit a couple of fingers in without squeezing, making it awkward to use for an adult

title: Not Recommended
review: I like having a 2 handle cup and though I checked making my coffee to fit the cup, the lid I wanted to use is to be inverted and if one did that, one would lose another ounce or so of coffee.  The sippy cup screwed on from the top but was difficult to remove.  I do not recommend to any average coffee drinker.I have ordered another company's larger cup.

title: For a child only
review: I bought this for my father. The handles are so small that only a child’s hands could grip them.

title: Lightweight and easy to hold.
review: It was a gift for an elderly friend, who had a stroke.  She was happy with the mug.  Just to be safe, I heated the liquid in a glass cup in the microwave and then poured it into the two-handled cup.  She drinks slowly, so I don't know how long the liquid stayed warm.  It is not insulated.

title: Good product... just not for us.
review: I know these work great for some.  Unfortunately, they didn't work out for us.  We ended up preferring the Kennedy Cup... sorry they just were a better fit.

title: Handles to small for most adults
review: This is a toddlers sippy cup. The handles are too small for my 85 yr old mom and the lid does not fasten in order to prevent spillage

title: It's a sippy cup for seniors
review: It's way over priced.  Just buy a cheaper sippy cup. It just about holds one cup. I have doubts about the microwave safe...it's the wrong sort of plastic

title: Exactly what I was looking for
review: This cup is perfect for my 95 year old great aunt. She has severe rheumatoid arthritis in her hands, the large handles allow her to pick up her cup without difficulty. The double handles make it easier for her to hold steady.

title: Good for kids too!
review: I actually use this for my one year old daughter for learning to hold a cup on her own. It's been successful so far. It's clear plastic and seems pretty tough, but I wouldn't put it in the dishwasher though. It's the size of an orange, so it isn't too big. The split is removable and easy to clean.

title: Handles should be larger.
review: It's like an adult sippy cup . There are 2 things that i feel would improve this item. First the handles are too small for adult twisted arthritic fingers to grasp. Secondly I feel a 10oz  capacity would be better than the 8oz.

title: Great for seniors
review: Worked great for letting me control the flow of liquid for my grandma in end stages of dementia. Stopped her from choking.

title: Must have for caregiving
review: Dishwasher safe. Easy to grip. Choice of lid styles. Once spouse hospitalized, I brought cups there and nursing staff loves them.

title: For a Child’s Hands
review: I purchased this hoping it would be helpful for my aging dad but it looks like it is for a child. Handles are much to small. It went back.

title: Only good if yr an adult without dementia
review: Really bad. The lid just sits in the cup. Spillage a problem!

title: Kids cup.
review: It would make a good kids cup.

title: Exactly as described!
review: My husband has Parkinson's disease and has difficulty with manual dexterity. This cup is great for his morning juice and for other drinking during the day. It also helps, I believe with his tendency to aspirate liquids. A real blessing!

title: Exactly what I needed
review: I love the two handle cup with  tremors it is Exactly what I needed

title: works
review: i got this for my mother who has terrbile shakes, it does help her

title: Poor product.
review: Cups crack and leak at bottom center. Had to throw away half of all not orders. Product is in my opinion defective and does not stand up to claims made in marketing.

title: Not as advertised.
review: My husband had a stroke and had to use both hands to guide the cup to his mouth.  I thought of the 'tommy tippy' cups for kids, then saw this cup listed as an 'adult', thinking it would be bigger and hold more than a child's cup.  It is not. I saw child cups bigger than this cup.  I am very disappointed in this product and the way it was advertised.

title: The two handles are perfect.
review: This has been a great help.  Mom can handle this by herself.

title: Was able to pour liquids directly into mouth once patient ...
review: Was able to pour liquids directly into mouth once patient was unable to drink through a straw or use a regular cup. No leakage with tight lid-to-cup fit.

title: Good quality.
review: Excellent product and reasonable price.  Bought for a stroke victim and this lets them drink and stay hydrated without spilling.

title: Double handle and lidded plastic glass
review: Perfect for Parkinson’s patients. Gives them some independence.

title: Handles are too smail for adult hands.
review: Overall good product for kids.

title: Patient likes it
review: Probably allows too much liquid for one who is aspirating.

title: I recommend this product for anyone who is bedridden
review: Used it for my dad when he was in hospice. It helped out greatly and made him feel independent while he was using it. I recommend this product for anyone who is bedridden.

title: For small drinkers
review: Smaller in real life. More for a toddler than a grown up.

title: Junk
review: Regretting that I didn't read the reviews before purchasing. Its cheaply made. Handles way too small for adults. Don't purchase it. It should be removed from Amazon.

title: finger holes too small
review: Finger holes are way too small for elderly disabled adult. This cup is for a child and was not disclosed in the product description..

title: so having an unbreakabke cup with two handles is nice.
review: My husband has Parkinson’s disease, so having an unbreakabke cup with two handles is nice.

title: not good for my senior mom
review: the handles were too small for her to grab.the top did not stay onit leaked.very cheapdon't buy it

title: Holds less than six ounces.
review: Too small and too expensive.

title: not for an adult
review: more for a child than an adult who is handicapped, we will make it work but not a good cup for my brother in law

title: Small size
review: To small hard to hold onto

title: Just what I Needed
review: This was just what I needed for my father who needed an adult sippy sup. Clear plastic comes with 2 lids, one with a sucking nub and one with a hole for a straw.

title: Got to work with my G-J Tube fed son. ...
review: Got to work with my G-J Tube fed son. So that I could work with him on trying to get to eat by mouth again!

title: It works great for mom
review: Mom loves it

title: Five Stars
review: small and easy to handle can be used for children or as an adaptive cup for adults.

title: Get what you pay for
review: Not what I expected. I thought it would be larger

title: All went well
review: Product is as posted!!!

title: 2 handle cups are wonderful.
review: Easy to use

title: Three Stars
review: handles are a little small for larger hands

title: Very Helpful
review: My wife has Parkinson's (PSP) and uses this cup to have a more secure grasp.

title: Awesome
review: Mom has  dementia

title: Very very small
review: Very small. It is like a tea cup size. The company was wonderful when it came to returning the cup.

title: good product
review: great product

title: Five Stars
review: THE RIGHT SIZE FOR MY HUSBAND'S COFFEE SINCE HE IS BEDRIDDEN.

title: CHEAPLY MADE
review: A LITTLE TOO EXPENSIVE FOR MY TASTE.

title: not a good product
review: wouldn't even secure fully drank kept coming out

title: Product durability
review: Liked the sturdiness of the product.

title: Five Stars
review: Great

title: Five Stars
review: perfect for husband's 60th birthday gift

title: Very great cups
review: Very great for a loved one very fast to ship

title: My mom loves it
review: My mom has Parkinson and this is very easy for her to hold and get the fluids she needs.

title: Very happy costumer....
review: Very happy this product....

title: Only holds 4 oz of it spills
review: Not user friendly

title: Thank you
review: It helps with everything I hoped for

title: Dont do it
review: Useless...Leakes like a sieve

title: There are better sippy cups
review: Not as large as expected, it's very small and not very sturdy made. Not worth buying

title: Too small
review: Way too small

title: Works great
review: My mom has Parkinson's and it easy for her to hold and drink by herself.

title: Cup for elderly person
review: Easy for my 93 year old mother to use

title: I love it. He handles it very well
review: This cup was ordered for my special needs son.  I love it.  He handles it very well.  However, he chews on the drinking spout and I was wondering if I could just order new tops since the cups are fine.

title: One Star
review: Too small

title: Works for my husband.
review: My disabled husband can use it.

title: Not good
review: It still leaked out.

title: Quality is great but be aware
review: Please explain to me why there are openings on the lid of this cup.... you make the slightest movement & liquid comes out. Quality is great but be aware, the lid is useless.

title: Adult sippy cup
review: The two lids and the size of the cup was perfect

title: Works well for my situation
review: Could have been a little larger

title: Two Stars
review: Cheap and small

title: Cheap
review: Cheap

title: the sippy cup is leak poof
review: my husband

title: Not for toddlers.
review: I thought I was going to use it for a toddler sippy cup.  Nope.  It is a good cup for adults though since it holds hot liquids too.  Sometimes you need a lid.  I especially like the easy dishwasher cleaning.

title: Four Stars
review: Good product

title: One Star
review: disappointed

title: Very small handles
review: This is identical to a child’s sippy cup without all the cute colors.  I bought this for my dad who is in hospice and having a difficult time lifting a cup. My mom wanted a lightweight cup with handles. It is both those things, but the handles are insanely small. Like 1 fingers worth for an adult man. Maybe this would work for an older woman or smaller person, but it was a huge disappointment for my situation. The picture shows me holding the cup. I can fit 2 fingers at most.

title: Perfect
review: Works very well...durable

title: Two Stars
review: I didn't realize it would be so small.
